body: Theater 'SEVEN IN ONE BLOW, OR THE BRAVE LITTLE KID,' an interactive adaptation of the Brothers Grimm fairy tale, by the Axis Theater Company, 1 Sheridan Square, off Seventh Avenue, West Village, (212)807-9300. title: SPARE TIMES; For Children

body: SOME businesses cluster in districts, others in buildings. The International Toy Center, at 200 Fifth Avenue and 24th Street in Manhattan, is to the toy industry what the garment district was to clothes: a thriving, industry-specific commercial zone, where companies of all sizes from around the globe gather to sell their goods. The Toy Center is a
title: ENTERTAINMENT; In One Building, Outposts For a Globe Full of Toys

body: LIKE many political candidates, Vinny Ignizio is immaculately dressed but poorly fed, accustomed to eating on the run. So it was not surprising one afternoon a few weeks ago to find the scrubbed, compact 30-year-old, who is running in a tough Republican primary on Staten Island for a state Assembly seat, sitting in his grandmother's curio-filled
title: Their Political Odyssey

body: Mary Montague said flying had kept her son, Ramsey Shockley, whom she described as being a ''wild child,'' out of trouble. ''He likes adventure,'' Ms. Montague said yesterday in a telephone interview from Phoenix. But flying led to trouble for Mr. Shockley, 25, on Sunday when the plane he was piloting made an emergency landing in the water in
title: Airplane Ditches At a Crowded Beach

body: A 25-year-old pilot was plucked safely from Rockaway Inlet off Brooklyn yesterday after he was forced to ditch a single-engine plane he had flown over the holiday beach crowds of Staten Island and New Jersey with aerial advertising in tow, the authorities said. ''This was a very fortunate young man,'' said Capt. Martin Zweig of the United States
title: Pilot Is Rescued After Crashing Off Brooklyn

body: Late last year, after Community Board 15 in Brooklyn had spent half a year on an increasingly contentious search for a district manager, City Councilman Lewis A. Fidler decided to give the board a stern talking-to. He reminded the 50 members of the board, whose jurisdiction includes Manhattan Beach, Sheepshead Bay and Gravesend, to keep their
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: SHEEPSHEAD BAY; Who Says You Can't Fire the Whole Team?

body: As a teenager 25 years ago in Communist Odessa, Alex Puzaitzer shared a cramped two-room apartment with his mother and older sister, spending nights on a sofa bed. But as a successful entrepreneur in capitalist Manhattan Beach, Brooklyn, he wanted something considerably more comfortable for his family. Two years ago, he bought a run-down stucco
title: Making It Big (the House, That Is); Immigrants' Lavish Homes Divide a Brooklyn Neighborhood

body: SINGER--Rabbi Dr. Joseph I. Beloved husband of the late Rebecca Heller Singer. Loving father of Alexander T., Linda Singer and Vivian S. Singer. Adoring grandfather of Glen Eric and Jason Evan. Devoted brother of the late Sophie Lewis. Rabbi of Manhattan Beach Jewish Center since 1947, and now Rabbi Emeritus since 1997. Author of the books Margin
title: Paid Notice: Deaths SINGER, RABBI DR. JOSEPH I.

body: Shortly after 9 p.m. Friday, dozens of people began gathering at the rear of the platform for Brooklyn-bound Q, N, R and W trains inside the Union Square subway station. Some wore flamboyant suits, others came in long gowns and strands of fake diamonds. One man wore a gray and white mask with the face of a cat. Another had dyed leopardlike spots in
title: A Rocking End to a Rolling, Screeching Gem

body: Joyful Actions And Reactions You almost expect to hear a carnival barker on the third floor of the American Museum of Natural History: ''Stop a tornado with your bare hands!'' ''See yourself suspended in air!'' And perhaps best of all, ''Trade noses with your friend!'' All this is possible, at least temporarily, and none of it involves magic. Quite
title: FAMILY FARE

body: HYMAN--Henry, 86, of Brooklyn, died on January 18, 2004. Loving husband of the late Rachel, devoted brother of Sy and the late Noel, adored uncle and dear friend. A rare human being loved by many, he will be missed by all. Funeral services Yablokoff Chapel, January 20, 1978 Coney Island Avenue, Brooklyn, at 11:00AM. HYMAN -- Henry. Temple Beth El
title: Paid Notice: Deaths HYMAN, HENRY
